intro: Lepidaploa gnaphalioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Lepidaploa gnaphalioides is often found in wetland ecosystems and is adapted to thrive in waterlogged soils.
